meanings.definition: To love more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outlove her siblings by giving them extra hugs.
meanings.sent2: I will outlove you by showering you with affection and care.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to outlove the kitten by bringing it a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outloves any negativity that comes her way.
meanings.sent5: In a world full of hate, she chooses to outlove instead.

meanings.definition: To show more love than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He will outlove his friends by always being there for them.
meanings.sent2: They outlove each other by constantly expressing their feelings.
meanings.sent3: The competition was to see who could outlove the other with gifts.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outloves any words she could say.
meanings.sent5: Their bond is so strong, they naturally outlove everyone around them.

meanings.sent1: She managed to outlove her own expectations by being incredibly caring.
meanings.sent2: The couple outloves all others with their deep connection.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outlove the dog by sharing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outloves any obstacles that come his way.
meanings.sent5: Their love outloves any doubts or fears they may have.
